item.title: Connecting a remote MongoDB database with R/Shiny
item.description: While making a Shiny App for a lab project (Sensor Overlord), I wanted to create a feature where users could input sensor data into a database, where it could be accessible to other users. I decided to give MongoDB a shot, mostly becuase of the free hosting services available on MongoDBâ€™s website. And it was actually extremely straightforward. There are great resources available online, like the mongolite user manual and the shiny persistent data storage page.
